title: Degree-balanced decompositions of cubic graphs
authors: Borut Lu\v{z}ar and Jakub Przyby{\l}o and Roman Sot\'ak
abstract:
We show that every cubic graph on $n$ vertices contains a spanning subgraph
in which the number of vertices of each degree deviates from $\frac{n}{4}$ by
at most $\frac{1}{2}$, up to three exceptions. This resolves the conjecture of
Alon and Wei (Irregular subgraphs, Combin. Probab. Comput. 32(2) (2023),
269--283) for cubic graphs.
